question.body: Why is it important for a broken bone to be “set” after a fracture, such that the surfaces at the fracture abut one another?

part.explanation: When a fracture heals, the cells that contribute to repair fill in between the broken surfaces. If the gap is too large, the cells cannot fill in the space, and if the bones are out of alignment, the bone can heal “crooked”. Making sure the surfaces are together and the bones aligned contributes to normal healing.
